items.title: Hey all -- this is the account for the Google Buzz team. We'll post all sorts of updates here abo...

object.content:
Hey all -- this is the account for the Google Buzz team. We'll post all sorts of updates here about what we're working on. Feel free to give us feedback and ideas on Google Buzz!

Here's a photo of our launch "war room" from last week. :-)

items.title: Nice Google Maps previews in Google Buzz Now when you paste a Google Maps link into the post box,...

object.content:
Nice Google Maps previews in Google Buzz

Now when you paste a Google Maps link into the post box, Buzz will automatically fetch a preview of the location you can associate with your post. More info here: http://gmailblog.blogspot.com/2010/06/google-maps-previews-in-gmail-and.html

attachments.title: Google Maps previews in Gmail and Google Buzz - Official Gmail Blog

items.title: New! View entire photo albums in Buzz Tired of only being able to view a handful of photos from a...

object.content:
New! View entire photo albums in Buzz

Tired of only being able to view a handful of photos from a given Flickr or Picasa album in Buzz's photo viewer? Now you can view the entire thing.

@Thomas Hawk -- we thought you'd appreciate this ;)

items.title: In case you missed it, videos of the Google I/O talks are now all live: http://code.google.com/ev...

object.content:
In case you missed it, videos of the Google I/O talks are now all live: http://code.google.com/events/io/2010/sessions.html

And for those of you interested in learning more about how to use the Buzz APIs, here's @Chris Chabot's talk:
Google I/O 2010 - What's the hubbub about Google Buzz APIs?

Thanks @Google I/O 2010!

attachments.title: Google I/O 2010 - What's the hubbub about Google Buzz APIs?
attachments.content:
Google I/O 2010 - What's the hubbub about Google Buzz APIs? 

Social Web 101 

Chris Chabot, Marco Kaiser (Seesmic), Ming Yong (Socialwok) 

Google Buzz is a new way to share updates, photos, videos and more, and start conversations about the things you find interesting. In this session, we'll take a deep dive into building with the Buzz APIs and the open standards it uses, such as ActivityStrea.ms, PubSubHubbub, OAuth, Salmon and WebFinger. 

For all I/O 2010 sessions, please go to http://code.google.com/events/io/2010/sessions.html

items.title: Two quick Buzz for mobile updates Yesterday we rolled out a new design for rendering location att...

object.content:
Two quick Buzz for mobile updates

Yesterday we rolled out a new design for rendering location attached to posts, including a better place icon, a bigger map, and an easy way to get directions from the post itself.

In addition, you can now disable comments from Buzz for mobile. (Look for this option under "More Actions").

items.title: Read about the updates we're making to the Google Buzz API (http://googlecode.blogspot.com/2010/0...

object.content: Read about the updates we're making to the Google Buzz API (http://googlecode.blogspot.com/2010/05/introducing-google-buzz-api.html) and check out some of the initial apps developers have created so far (http://www.google.com/buzz/apps)!

attachments.title: Google Code Blog: Introducing the Google Buzz API
attachments.content: The official Google developer blog.  The latest news on Google APIs and developer tools.

items.title: Reshare - coming out today! When you find an interesting buzz post you want to reshare, instead o...

object.content:
Reshare - coming out today!

When you find an interesting buzz post you want to reshare, instead of copying and pasting it (and maybe attributing the original poster with an @reply along the way), you'll now be able to reshare posts with two clicks. If you don't see the "Reshare" link quite yet, hang tight. It should be on for everyone by the end of the day.

Learn more at: http://gmailblog.blogspot.com/2010/05/reshare-in-google-buzz.html

attachments.title: "Reshare" in Google Buzz - Official Gmail Blog

items.title: When Google Buzz launched, it was only available for devices running Android 2.0+ and iPhone. Not...

object.content:
When Google Buzz launched, it was only available for devices running Android 2.0+ and iPhone. Not any more! Today we’re a releasing an XHTML version of the Buzz website which can be accessed from many other mobile devices, including those running Android pre-2.0, Blackberry, Nokia S60, and Windows Mobile.

Read more at http://googlemobile.blogspot.com/2010/05/google-buzz-for-mobile-now-available-on.html

attachments.title: Google Buzz for mobile now available on more devices - Official Google Mobile Blog

object.content:
Need a refresher on how to post by email? Want an easy way to show your mom how to share privately? Check out the 7 tips videos we just added to the Google Buzz YouTube Channel.

Following: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MFo2WvPPgfE
Comments & likes: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3H0or0Tnrt8
Photos, links & videos: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sDZAPBy-ups

Post via email: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JGjj4IGSGQw

items.title: Improved comment collapsing has been one of our top requests. Read about the changes we're making...

object.content:
Improved comment collapsing has been one of our top requests. Read about the changes we're making that'll be live for everyone by the end of the day: http://gmailblog.blogspot.com/2010/04/improved-comment-collapsing-for-google.html

Let us know what you think!

attachments.title: Official Gmail Blog: Improved comment collapsing for Google Buzz posts

items.title: Thanks for submitting your Google Buzz suggestions (nearly 1000 of them!) to our Product Ideas pa...

object.content:
Thanks for submitting your Google Buzz suggestions (nearly 1000 of them!) to our Product Ideas page. We've already made some changes based on your requests, like adding inbox controls and better comment collapsing, and more improvements are in the works. We're interested to see how your feedback has changed -- if at all -- since we first opened up the Product Ideas page last month, so we've started a fresh new topic for the month of April. Don't worry -- we're still reading your your suggestions from March, and plan to address many of them over the next few months, so you shouldn't feel obligated to re-submit ideas.

http://productideas.appspot.com/#16/e=4a51a

items.title: 3 new Buzz tips: 1) Deliver posts to your inbox (something that's been requested by a number of y...

object.content:
3 new Buzz tips:
1) Deliver posts to your inbox (something that's been requested by a number of you!)
2) Disable comments on conversations that have run their course (another highly requested feature)
3) Shared links now have favicons.

Read more here: http://gmailblog.blogspot.com/2010/04/3-buzz-tips-deliver-posts-to-your-inbox.html

attachments.title: 3 Buzz tips: Deliver posts to your inbox, disable comments, and favicons for links - Official Gmail Blog

items.title: You can now see the Buzz layer on Google Maps on your computer. Look for it under the “More...” m...

object.content: You can now see the Buzz layer on Google Maps on your computer. Look for it under the “More...” menu: http://google-latlong.blogspot.com/2010/04/google-buzz-layer-now-available-for.html

attachments.title: Google LatLong: Google Buzz layer now available for Google Maps on your computer

items.title: Tweets with location now showing with Buzz on the map If you've added Twitter as a connected site...

object.content:
Tweets with location now showing with Buzz on the map

If you've added Twitter as a connected site in Google Buzz and your tweets have a location (via Twitter or other services), they'll now appear in the mobile buzz.google.com "Nearby" view and on the Buzz layer in Google Maps (both mobile and desktop). Check out one of these views to see buzz posts, tweets and more around you.

items.title: New! Google Buzz buttons Google Buzz buttons will start appearing on sites around the web today, ...

object.content:
New! Google Buzz buttons

Google Buzz buttons will start appearing on sites around the web today, so you can post to Buzz without leaving the site you're on. You can also add buttons to your own site to make it easy for people to share your stuff or follow you on Buzz. Read more on the Gmail blog: http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2010/04/google-buzz-buttons.html

attachments.title: Official Google Blog: Google Buzz buttons

items.title: New! Comment via email Read more here: http://gmailblog.blogspot.com/2010/05/comment-via-email-an...

object.content:
New! Comment via email

Read more here: http://gmailblog.blogspot.com/2010/05/comment-via-email-and-view-entire-photo.html

attachments.title: Comment via email and view entire photo albums in Google Buzz - Official Gmail Blog

items.title: Help test new Google Buzz features We're recruiting Gmail users to provide early feedback on Goog...

object.content:
Help test new Google Buzz features

We're recruiting Gmail users to provide early feedback on Google Buzz features in the works. If you’re adventurous and like testing experimental new stuff and providing candid feedback and bug reports, we’d love your help!

Interested?
1) Fill out this form: http://goo.gl/Af2w ( Update : Thanks to everyone who volunteered! The testing group is now full, so we've closed the form.)
2) We’ll respond to you as soon as we can (assuming we’re not at capacity already).
3) If you haven’t signed a non-disclosure agreement with Google before, we'll send you one. If you’ve been a Google Trusted Tester before, you should be covered.
Note that your Gmail experience might be a wee bit buggier than usual, and you can opt-out of participating at any time.

items.title: Buzz buttons now on Picasa Web Albums (http://googlephotos.blogspot.com/2010/04/more-ways-to-shar...

object.content: Buzz buttons now on Picasa Web Albums (http://googlephotos.blogspot.com/2010/04/more-ways-to-share-your-photos.html) and YouTube (http://youtube-global.blogspot.com/2010/04/release-notes-five-new-languages-email.html). Let more photo and video sharing commence!
